channel.title: dotNET Weekly - Week undefined Year undefined

item.title: Microsoft® and the .NET Foundation announce the release of version 1.0 of .NET for Apache® Spark™
item.content:encoded:
It is our pleasure to announce the release of version 1.0 of .NET for Apache® Spark™, an open source package that brings .NET development to the Apache® Spark™ platform.
The new 1.0 release of .NET for Apache® Spark™ includes the following:
Support for .NET applications targeting .NET Standard 2.0 (.NET Core 3.1 or later recommended). Support for Apache® Spark™ 2.4/3.0 DataFrame APIs including the ability to write Spark SQL. For example:

item.title: Microsoft.Identity.Web is now generally available!
item.content:encoded: We’re excited to announce that Microsoft.Identity.Web is now generally available. Microsoft.Identity.Web brings a renewed, simplified, end-to-end experience for developers to build secured-by-default web apps or web APIs, possibly calling Microsoft Graph or other web APIs.

item.title: C# 9 The unknown goodies
item.content:encoded: C# 9 brings many new big features and a few little goodies that are super useful and not enough known. They may not deserve a blog post of their own, but shouldn't be forgotten either. So here they are! Discover all the hidden gems in C# 9 that nobody talks about. Module initializers simplified null check, covariant returns, and native sized integers.

item.title: How we do bundling and minification in ASP.NET Core
item.content:encoded: Learn about how we have implemented bundling and minification in ASP.NET Core with the help of bundleconfig.json, the BundlerMinifier package, and gulp.
